@metadata.name: ustring
@metadata.comment: The library is imported as default, it is "implied", and can be fully identified by the library prefix. This is nearly always named as "mw.html", as it is part of the standard mw-lib, so it is pretty safe to assume it can be used as prefix.

mw.ustring 001.description: The maximum allowed length of a pattern, in bytes.

mw.ustring 002.description: The maximum allowed length of a ustring, in bytes.

mw.ustring 003.description: Returns the ustring as an array of bytes.

mw.ustring 004.description: Returns the byte offset of a character in the ustring.

mw.ustring 005.description: Returns the arguments as a ustring of chars.

mw.ustring 006.description: Returns the ustring as an array of codepoints.

mw.ustring 007.description: Search for the first occurence of pattern within the ustring.

mw.ustring 008.description: Formats the ustring, and injects optional arguments.

mw.ustring 009.description: Creates an iterator for the codepoints from the given arguments.

mw.ustring 010.description: Creates an iterator for the captures from the given arguments.

mw.ustring 011.description: Returns the ustring with occurences of patterns replaced.

mw.ustring 012.description: Checks whether the ustring is valid UTF-8.

mw.ustring 013.description: Calculates the length of the string in bytes.

mw.ustring 014.description: Change all unicode uppercase letters to lowercase.

mw.ustring 015.description: Returns the first part matched by pattern.

mw.ustring 016.description: Returns a string with n copies of s.

mw.ustring 017.description: Returns the part given by the arguments.

mw.ustring 018.description: Converts the string to Normalization Form C.

mw.ustring 019.description: Converts the string to Normalization Form D.

mw.ustring 020.description: Change all unicode lowercase letters to uppercase.
